Reviews.Title: This isn't the Pro 2 so it does only have 4gb of RAM
Reviews.Author: Kasey
Reviews.Content: This is a great Tablet PC and the best build quality on the market. Only issue is the charging connector is sometimes a pain hence the 4 stars not 5.

Reviews.Title: For the artist
Reviews.Author: Cyn
Reviews.Content: I love the tablet for the drawing option right on the screen. My only complaint is the inteface with PhotoShop as it does not allow you to expand the tools to a size that can be seen on the small screen. Also an Alt click is not possible with the stylist for like the clone tool so I had to buy a keyboard just for the one function. Maybe that is a PhotoSHop issue. Otherwise, the size and weight are perfect like holding a sketch book. The stylist needs a little adjusting as it is not true to pick however manageable.  I also love the handwriting recognition. It is very true to recognition and there was no pre setup. Waited a long time for this. Am not disappointed. I would definately get the larger RAM and Memory as stated in other reviews it comes dikuted with preinstalled programs that eat into the storage.

Reviews.Title: Amazing tablet.  Does everything I hoped it would and does it well.
Reviews.Author: Peter Keene
Reviews.Content: It's a seriously good piece of portable hardware.  Good specs, good software, great pen for art.  Good accessories.My only con is that it gets pretty warm in heavy use and charging, but not dangerously hot.  Also managed to get a great price.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: C S Middleton
Reviews.Content: Both my husband and son are using the Microsoft Surface Pro Tablets I ordered.  The tablet works for work and school.  They love them.  Delivery was late, but I guess the storms around Christmas were to blame.

Reviews.Title: Finally a great all in one tablet/pc
Reviews.Author: Colby Taperts
Reviews.Content: Last years model was not that great but Microsoft did a 360 on the Surface 2. The CPU on all the newer Surfaces bought later have been overclocked to 1.9ghz and this one was blazing fast. I love the portability and ease of use of the touch screen great for our business and for personal use.

Reviews.Title: Impressive but can be sensitive.
Reviews.Author: Charlotte Johnson
Reviews.Content: Generally, all programs work together impressively but it seems a bit instable in setting up PPt projections and pen can be erratic with certain photoshop tools - working with it...

Reviews.Title: Not a Surface Pro 2.
Reviews.Author: Handegard
Reviews.Content: The Surface Pro is a 5 star device. I am giving this a low score because it's NOT what they said it was.This is NOT A SURFACE PRO 2This is NOT A 4th GEN HASWELL CPUThis is NOT WINDOWS 8.1 (but it is admittedly a free upgrade)I expected a good deal on a Surface Pro 2, I ended up overpaying for a Surface Pro 1.

Reviews.Title: I like this tablet.
Reviews.Author: IAmThePowerOfFriendship
Reviews.Content: It's pretty decent. handles most of the things I need it for. Good for notes in class. I can record lectures with the rear facing camera.I have no real complaints about this other than the stylus and the battery life. The Stylus feels cheap and the battery life kinda sucks. I usually get a couple hours on it depending on what I'm doing. I heard that the Surface Pro 2 has a much better battery life though so I guess it's moot. The stylus is pretty nice to draw with but it feels cheap and it's easy to use. I hope that with subsequent generations of this tablet they give it a slot to store the stylus inside of the tablet instead of forcing me to magnetically holster it to the side.Regardless, if you need a decent tablet for work and don't want to carry both a tablet and a laptop this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: good computer with a few querks
Reviews.Author: Thomas Snyder "Morphius"
Reviews.Content: I love the computer, but have had a few problems with it when organizing my folders and the hundreds of files I put into each folder. I'm an organizer, a planner and implementor, and when my computer can't keep up with my organization plans I get a little upset. My computers must all be stand-alone computers, where nothing is kept online, or in the cloud, as you say. I don't like my computer connected 24/7 to the internet. I turn it on when i need it, and not until then. But my new Surface  seems to want a connection all the time, which I would never allow. I like it, but it requires far too much time online to keep running properly.
